metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5400 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Memory leak in the airspy_probe function in drivers/media/usb/airspy/airspy.c in the airspy USB driver in the Linux kernel before 4.7 allows local users to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a crafted USB device that emulates many VFL_TYPE_SDR or VFL_TYPE_SUBDEV devices and performs many connect and disconnect operations. James Patrick-Evans discovered that the airspy USB device driver in the Linux kernel did not properly handle certain error conditions. An attacker with physical access could use this to cause a denial of service (memory consumption).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5400` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-3.19.0-68-generic - 3.19.0-68.76~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-68-generic-lpae - 3.19.0-68.76~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-68-lowlatency - 3.19.0-68.76~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-68-powerpc-e500mc - 3.19.0-68.76~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-68-powerpc-smp - 3.19.0-68.76~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-68-powerpc64-emb - 3.19.0-68.76~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-68-powerpc64-smp - 3.19.0-68.76~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-3.19.0-68-generic - 3.19.0-68.76~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-36-generic - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-lowlatency - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1

linux-image-4.4.0-36-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-36-generic - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-36-generic - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-lowlatency - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support

criterions.comment: linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-vivid package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.19.0-68.76~14.04.1').
linux-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1').
